alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Matagorda (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 01 at 6:08PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: .Heavy rainfall is no longer in the area. Any urban and small stream flooding is expected to slowly recede. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected to slowly recede. * WHERE...Portions of south central Texas and southeast Texas, including the following counties, in south central Texas, Jackson. In southeast Texas, Matagorda. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 603 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms. Any urban and small stream flooding will be slow to recede. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Western Bay City, Markham, Blessing and Midfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
